newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Samsung denies Ssangyong Motor takeover report.
newsitem.headline: Samsung denies Ssangyong Motor takeover report.

text.p: South Korea's Samsung Group on Monday denied a news report it was in talks to aquire Ssangyong Motor Co.
"The whole report is absolutely false," said Cho Jang-won, a Samsung Group spokesman.
The Chosun Ilbo newspaper reported over the weekend that Samsung Group was in takeover talks with Ssangyong Group
The paper quoted unnamed sources at Ssangyong Group as saying a meeting between the two groups was held in mid-September at a hotel in central Seoul to discuss the deal.
Samsung Group formed a technical tie-up with Nissan Motor Co of Japan and established Samsung Motors Inc to enter the already crowded passenger car industry from 1998.
But the Chosun Ilbo report said technology transfer from Nissan had not been smooth and Samsung had begun shopping for another partner.
Ssangyong group spokesman Park Joong-seok also denied the report. "These kind of rumours have been circulating for more than three or four years," he said.
Ssangyong Motor posted a net loss of 126.22 billion won in calendar 1995 on turnover of 986.74 billion won, compared with a 79.32 billion shortfall on 805.93 billion sales in 1994.
